;;泰勒·斯威夫特周二晚在 2023 年 MTV 音乐录影带颁奖典礼上登台
;

;泰勒·斯威夫特 ;再一次; 在 MTV 音乐录影带大奖 (VMA) 上占据主导地位，在所有被提名的电视转播类别中均获奖，这个夜晚原本是庆祝拉丁音乐的，包括夏奇拉的卓越成就，以及嘻哈音乐 50 周年。

;

;Swift，目前处于 ;历史上首次价值十亿美元的体育场巡演;，她凭借午夜单曲《Anti-Hero》夺得了当晚最高奖项、年度最佳视频，以及年度最佳导演、最佳流行视频和歌曲。< /p>;

;

;;相关：;;MTV VMA 2023：红地毯上闪亮的新娘内衣游行 - 图片;

;
;

;这位 33 岁的歌手将她的胜利献给了歌曲创作艺术以及主持人“NSync”（十多年来首次重聚，为她颁发了一个奖项），以及她的视频剪辑师 Chancler Hanes 和电影摄影师 Rina Yang（代表斯威夫特发言，赢得了年度视频奖）

;

;继去年与 LL Cool J 和 Jack Harlow 分担司仪职责后，Nicki Minaj 接任新泽西保德信中心第 40 届年度 VMA 的唯一主持人，并获得最佳嘻哈奖-hop，她的歌曲《Super Freaky Girl》。 “我经常开玩笑、玩耍等等，但今晚，我不知道为什么，今天早上我刚醒来，我就有了这种非常强烈的感激之情，”她说。

; <图数据- media-id="8e6029954b5c4b670e568c43280d41001f838d23">; ; ; ;

;这场以表演为主、相对没有混乱的 VMA 在近四个小时的仪式上花了很大一部分时间来庆祝嘻哈音乐 50 周年，从 Lil Wayne 的晚间开幕表演开始到《Metro Boomin》的 VMA 首秀，到由 Doug E Fresh、Grandmaster Flash 和速度与激情五人组、LL Cool J、Run DMC 的 Darryl McDaniels、Lil Wayne 和 Minaj 本人主演的压轴混合曲目。

;

;Mary J Blige 出席全球偶像奖颁给了吹牛老爹（Diddy），他的真名是肖恩·库姆斯（Sean Combs）。 “没有人比这个人更值得被称为偶像，”布莱格在谈到这位说唱歌手、制作人、商业大亨和唱片执行官时说道，他与儿子 King 一起表演了一系列热门歌曲，从《Mo Money Mo Problems》到《Last Night with Keyshia Cole》库姆斯。

;

;“爱会获胜，你们大家。爱获胜，”库姆斯在一次演讲中说道，讲述了他作为报童的出身，然后在纽约俱乐部跳舞（“跳我的迪迪吉格舞”）出演音乐录影带。 “我感谢你们所有人的到来，给我鲜花并庆祝我……这对我来说是梦想成真。”

; ;

;VMA 还认可了拉丁音乐在全球的统治地位，这些艺术家包括巴西人 Anitta（凭借 Funk Rave 赢得最佳拉丁音乐奖）、墨西哥突破艺术家 Peso Pluma 和哥伦比亚歌手 Karol G（成为最佳拉丁音乐奖得主）。第一位与 Mañana Será Bonito 合作的西班牙语专辑排名第一的女艺人;。;

;

;Karol G 凭借与哥伦比亚同胞夏奇拉 (Shakira) 的最佳合作奖而获得最佳合作奖，夏奇拉是当晚的嘉宾。歌曲TGQ。 “她是一个传奇。她代表了我们的国家和我们的拉丁裔社区。”Karol G 用西班牙语说道。

;

;Wyclef Jean 向夏奇拉颁发了视频先锋奖，以表彰她对全球音乐的贡献。 “如果没有夏奇拉，拉丁音乐就不会成为全球性的力量，”他在谈到这位 46 岁的哥伦比亚歌手时说道，夏奇拉表演了一系列热门歌曲，使她从《盒子里的扭曲》（《She Wolf》）一跃成为舞台中央。一边用刀跳舞（无论何时何地）一边进行人群冲浪，同时演唱 BZRP Music Sessions, Vol 53。在轻快的获奖感言中，夏奇拉向帮助她突破行业界限的“了不起的女性”致敬，她的两个儿子 Milan 和 Sasha 以及她的粉丝“无论遇到什么困难都始终支持我。非常感谢你们成为我的军队，帮助我打好所有的仗。”

; ;

;对于女性表演者来说，这是一个胜利之夜，她们占据了大部分演出名单。奥利维亚·罗德里戈 (Olivia Rodrigo) 用她第二张专辑《Guts》中尖锐、烟火般的曲目拼贴拉开了当晚的序幕，卡迪·B (Cardi B) 和梅根·西·斯塔林 (Megan Thee Stallion) 首次表演了他们的新单曲 Bongos，充满活力。 《Doja Cat》引起了全场注意，《Paint the Town Red and Demons》，两侧是一群涂着血色油漆的女舞者，而 Anitta 则唱着歌，跳着电臀舞，演绎了《Used To Be》。

;

;The最佳 R&B 奖颁给了歌手 SZA，但她没有出席，而最佳新人奖颁给了说唱歌手 Ice Spice（“大声喊出布朗克斯！”她说）。最佳韩国流行音乐奖颁给了 The Strays，他们与 Tomorrow x Together 一起首次亮相 VMA。

;

;蒂芙尼·哈迪什 (Tiffany Haddish) 凭借歌曲《Calm Down》将有史以来第一个电视转播的最佳非洲节奏奖颁给了雷玛 (Rema) 和赛琳娜·戈麦斯 (Selena Gomez) 。 “今晚能在这个舞台上代表非洲节奏，我很高兴……我们来这里是为了把它带到世界其他地方，”这位尼日利亚歌手兼说唱歌手说道。戈麦斯表示，她“非常荣幸”能够参与此次合作，这是第一首由非洲艺术家主导的歌曲，在 Spotify 上的播放量达到 10 亿次，并向尼日利亚表达了“我所有的爱”。

;

;但是这个夜晚属于斯威夫特，她在舞台上宣布了她的第十张录音室专辑《Midnights》一年后，以另一项年度最佳视频奖结束了演出。 “事实上，这是一个由粉丝投票选出的奖项，这对我来说意义重大，”她谈到当晚的顶峰奖时说道。 “今晚我要说的就是谢谢你们。我惊呆了。”

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 14:22:02 +0800 EU states must bridge ‘planning gap’ in order to hit climate targets, report warnshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/sep/13/eu-states-must-bridge-planning-gap-in-order-to-hit-climate-targets-report-warns
;;2023-09-13T05:00:02Z;
;
;;德国格雷文布罗赫附近的一座燃煤发电厂
;

;欧洲国家必须架起巨大的“桥梁”一份报告称，其气候目标和行动计划之间存在“规划差距”。

;

;欧盟成员国 2019 年制定的国家能源和气候计划 (NECP) 已经过时、缺乏关键细节且不一致根据非营利环境组织清洁空气工作组的分析，制定长期战略。在欧盟六月计划草案最后期限过去两个月后，只有一半的州提交了新提案。

;

;“对于我们规划、许可和建设电力系统来说，三十年是一个非常短的时期。该报告的主要作者、来自 CATF 的 Alejandra Muñoz Castañer; ; 说道。各国政府有一个“一次性的机会，真正更加认真地对待他们的规划工作，这是他们过去没有做过的”。

;

;报告呼吁成员国利用他们的行动计划来支持更广泛的计划。一系列清洁技术，向投资者发出更清晰的信号，告诉他们把钱投向何处，并规划输电线塔和氢气管道等跨境基础设施。

;

;它还要求更加注重解决培训等实际问题足够的工人，使清洁能源项目更容易获得许可。

;

;欧盟委员会发言人表示，正在与成员国密切合作，确保及时提交计划，并将发布评估报告到今年年底。

;

;欧盟承诺到本世纪末将温室气体污染比 1990 年的水平减少至少 55%，并到 2050 年实现净零排放。但是 ;欧洲审计法院 6 月份的报告;发现“几乎没有迹象表明实现 2030 年气候和能源目标的行动就足够了”。

;

;委员会表示，NECP 概述了政府将如何实现其能源和气候目标，对于调动实现 2030 年气候和能源目标所需的大规模投资至关重要。气候中和和能源安全。最后一轮计划是在 Covid-19 大流行和欧盟绿线复苏计划之前不久制定的。

;

;自那时以来，俄罗斯入侵乌克兰，导致天然气价格飙升，并引发了欧洲大陆推动能源增长的努力安全，而美国通过了一项具有里程碑意义的气候法案，引发了支持清洁技术的全球竞赛。

;

;欧盟也彻底修改了自己的气候目标。自上一轮计划以来，中国已将 2030 年可再生能源目标从 32% 提高到 42.5%，能源效率提高目标从 32.5% 提高到 36%，土地利用碳减排目标从 2.25 亿吨提高到 3.1 亿吨。

; CATF 清洁能源分析师、该报告的合著者 Nicole Pavia 表示，制定雄心勃勃的目标是重要的一步，“但我们看到各国、地区、成员国和整个欧盟面临的困难是：从今天到 2030 年，我们如何实现？”

;

;只有少数国家在 6 月底满足了欧盟下一轮 NECP 的最后期限，截至 9 月中旬，27 个成员国中只有 15 个国家已经提交了一份草案。

;

;落后者包括欧洲两个最大的温室气体污染国德国和法国，以及第四大的波兰。意大利、西班牙和荷兰以及十几个较小的污染国已经提交了更新的计划。

;

;气候智库 E3G 的政策顾问拉斐尔·哈诺托 (Raphael Hanoteaux) 表示，欧盟正在迅速推动增加可再生能源和减少化石天然气的消耗这意味着“及时提交这些计划至关重要”。

;

;成员国也看到了国内优先事项的转变。例如，德国宪法法院于 2021 年下令更新其气候法，因为其中的条款“不可逆转地将主要减排负担转移到 2030 年之后”。

;

;8 月，德国环境局发现与 2021 年相比，该国已缩小了政策与目标之间 70-80% 的差距，但“仍需要采取额外措施”来清理其交通、建筑和工业部门。

;

;德国上一次的 NECP“更像是一次勾选练习”，非营利组织 Germanwatch 的欧盟气候政策顾问 Charly Heberer 表示。 “我们希望下一轮 NECP 得到更全面的考虑。”

;

;与此同时，在中欧和东欧，上一轮 NECP“实施不力”，并且与欧盟的联系不够紧密可能有助于推动变革的资金，;来自非政府组织 Bankwatch 于 6 月发现的报告;。

;

;清洁空气工作组报告呼吁各国政府在 2030 年至 2040 年之后“将各个点连接起来”到 2050 年，并更好地跟踪实现这一目标的进展。欧盟尚未设定 2040 年温室气体污染目标，但计划在 2024 年 5 月选举前设定。

;

;其科学顾问委员会在 ;六月报告;表明欧盟应致力于减排到 2040 年，这一比例将比 1990 年的水平提高 90-95%。

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 13:22:02 +0800 China unveils Taiwan economic ‘integration’ plan as warships conduct manoeuvres off coasthttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/china-unveils-taiwan-economic-integration-plan-as-warships-conduct-manoeuvres-off-coast
;;2023-09-13T05:17:36Z;
;
;;台北101大楼
;

;中国政府与台湾推出“融合发展新路径” ，包括提出让台湾人民更容易在中国生活、学习和工作的建议。

;

;同时，它派出了多年来最大规模的军舰聚集到台湾东部海域，分析人士所说，这标志着在和平“统一”和军事暴力之间做出选择，距离台湾总统选举仅几个月。

;

;执政的共产党中央委员会和国务院周二发布的新措施称，沿海省份福建将成为一体化发展“示范区”。

;
;

;;相关：;;沮丧的中国加强了台湾周边的军舰和战斗机活动;

;
;

;这21条措施包括便利台胞在闽居住和享受社会服务、扩大福建学校台籍学生招生、深化产业合作等。

;

;“此举旨在深化两岸融合发展，推动两岸融合发展。”官方媒体《中国日报》表示：“中国日报是一个强硬的国家支持的新闻媒体，《环球时报》称这份文件“相当于勾画了未来。

;

;《中国日报》称，厦门金门、福州马祖“对城”将发挥“更加突出的作用”。金门岛和马祖岛距离中国大陆仅几公里，具有一定的文化和经济联系，;中国房地产市场危机;。

;

;“中国政府已经在自己的人民中割韭菜了，现在他们转向台湾人，”一位评论者说，习近平希望在没有战争的情况下与台湾“统一”，尽管他表示准备使用武力。这一整合计划恰逢中国军舰在西太平洋集结，进行看似重大的军事演习。

;

;周一，中国人民解放军 (PLA) ;派出一个航母战斗群;越过台湾南端进入西太平洋，由山东号航空母舰。台湾还发现数十架战机在台湾海峡中线和南部岛屿上空飞行新的更长的航线，并伴随着该打击群。

;

;周二，日本防卫省发现了两支舰队八艘军舰正在冲绳以南的宫古海峡航行，分析人士称其航线可能会与山东领导的集团会合。台湾国防部表示，周三上午又发现了 36 架次战机出动。国防与安全研究所分析师苏子云对英国《金融时报》表示，如果这些团体会聚，这将形成有史以来最大规模的涉及中国航母的演习。

;

;在台湾高级军事官员黄文奇将军周二对媒体表示，山东舰“无疑构成了新的威胁”。

;

;中国当局尚未就此次演习发表任何声明，截至发稿时也没有导航信息对该地区发出警告。解放军上次与山东舰在台湾东部举行大型演习，是对台湾总统蔡英文与美国众议院议长凯文·麦卡锡会面的回应。分析人士告诉《卫报》，他们怀疑本周的活动是为了回应最近通过台湾海峡以及美国和盟国参与的联合演习，以及对台湾持续的军事威胁。

;

;一月份，台湾将下届总统选举即将举行，人们普遍预计北京将像前几年那样，在竞选期间寻求影响选民。它最反对执政的民进党（民进党）获胜，该党在维护台湾主权国家地位方面最为强硬。民进党总统候选人、副总统赖清德是目前的领先者。

;

;然而，反对党 — — 以及越来越多的台湾人民 — — 也拒绝接受中国统治的前景。 2016 年蔡英文上台后，北京切断了与台北的正式沟通。

;

;亚洲协会政策研究所常务董事罗里·丹尼尔斯 (Rorry Daniels) 周三表示，和平一体化计划的双重信号，同时进行了密集的军事行动演习是信息混乱的一个迹象。

;

;“台湾人民应该如何解释这一点？去大陆寻找巨大的经济机会，但飞越我们包围你的岛屿的军舰？”

;

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 13:22:02 +0800 Exiled Chinese dissidents alarmed by ‘spy’ arrest of Westminster researcherhttps://www.theguardian.com/politics/2023/sep/13/exiled-chinese-dissidents-alarmed-by-spy-arrest-of-westminster-researcher
;;2023-09-13T04:00:49Z;
;
;;国会大厦
;

;Finn Lau 与一名威斯敏斯特研究员的会面，该研究员后来因涉嫌对中国的间谍活动只持续了20分钟。近一年后，他正在考虑潜在的后果。

;

;刘是一位流亡的香港民主活动人士，悬赏 10 万英镑，他一直怀疑自己的一些施加更大压力的想法关于中国的问题似乎没有超出他们的会议范围。

;

;刘等流亡的中国持不同政见者，以及香港活动人士和其他人，包括西藏独立和中国维吾尔少数民族的倡导者，在会议结束后提出了担忧该研究人员于三月份被捕的消息是在周末传出的。该男子尚未被警方透露姓名，但此后表示他是;“完全无辜”;并拒绝了他所说的“奢侈的新闻报道”。

;

;这些社区长期以来一直抱怨自己成为目标中国当局在示威活动或网上进行的监视。关于中国在英国设立海外“警察局”的说法也是一个长期关注的问题。

;

;“我们对被监视并不陌生，但本周却引起了人们的注意。这是一个在华人社区中广为流传的故事。”刘说。每次他踏上伦敦的路，他都会继续采取安全对策。他说，最近有人冒充中国一家知名广播新闻台的记者，试图采访他。

;

;被捕的研究人员拥有议会通行证并与部长们有联系。 ，被认为与中国没有亲属关系。刘说：“这并没有改变我的行为。但我认为人们现在也会更加谨慎地对待与谁交往，无论他们的肤色是什么。你可能会说，如果它打破了所谓的中国间谍的刻板印象，那么这甚至是有好处的。”

;

;刘呼吁对议会的审查措施进行审计 — — 这是他和他共同建立的制度。香港活动人士辩称，有时他们会更难参与英国的民主进程。

;

;保守党议员蒂姆·劳顿 (Tim Loughton) 本周谈到了他如何试图聘用来自英国的实习生。从香港前往英国，但议会安全部门拒绝了他们，因为他们已经离开英国三年了，而且来自中国。出生于香港、现居住在英国的民主活动家呼吁向那些向议员提供信息、现在担心自己可能面临危险的人提供保证。

;

;;A black and white image of workers at a cotton ginning mill
;

;For more than 230 years, a small community of Gullah-Geechee people have called Sapelo Island off the coast of Georgia home. Hogg Hammock, the area on the island where these descendants of enslaved people live, is a 427-acre coastal community of 40 residents and has been designated as a historic site since 1996. That means that the construction of houses more than 1,400 sq ft and any road paving or demolition of property are strictly prohibited to preserve the island community.

;
;

;;Related: ;; Atlanta police arrest five activists chained to bulldozer at 'Cop City' site;

;
;

;On Tuesday, McIntosh county commissioners, who preside over Sapelo, voted to remove zoning restrictions in Hogg Hammock. Gullah-Geechee residents fear that wealthy transplants who want to develop larger homes and who could force a rise of property taxes there will displace them and upend their livelihoods.

;

;The county, which is 65% white, has voted to remove official language that acknowledges Hogg Hammock as an area with “unique needs in regard to its historic resources”. It will also strike language that states it should prevent “land value increases which could force removal of the indigenous population”.

;

;The vote represents the latest dispute between county officials and the small historic Black community. Back in 2012, Hogg Hammock residents protested against the county's raising of property taxes – which the county then rolled back. And in 2015, the community sued the county in federal court alleging that it had racially discriminated against residents by failing to provide them with adequate services. The island's residents had paid county taxes for schools, police and fire departments, and trash collection services – none of which extended to Sapelo Island. The county settled the lawsuit last year, agreeing to give emergency and road services and freeze property taxes for some residents.

; ;

;Last Thursday, dozens of residents ;gave hours of testimony; to the county's zoning board arguing against the proposed changes, warning that the county had hastily made changes without community consideration. Reginal Hall, a landowner whose family had roots in Hogg Hummock, ;told; the Associated Press the county's approval would amount to “the erasure of a historical culture that's still intact after 230 years”.

;

;Residents and ;state lawmakers ;called for the county to delay their vote and to reflect on proposed changes for 90 days. “We will not allow our cultural history to be erased or bought at the price of land developers,” the state representative Kim Schofield, who represents Atlanta, ;told reporters;. “This is our history and our heritage, and we will fight to protect it.”

;

;Hall warned the county's vote to remove development limits would give Gullah -Geechee residents in Hogg Hammock just “two to three years at most” to survive in the county before they scatter elsewhere, as 200,000 Gullah-Geechee people have already done across the south-eastern corridor of the United States. “If you talk about the descendants of the enslaved,” she said, “90% of us will be gone.”

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 09:52:01 +0800 Kim Jong-un expected to hold weapons talks with Putin at remote Russian space basehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/kim-jong-un-putin-weapons-talk-russian-space-base-amur

;;North Korean leader Kim Jong-un shaking hands with Primorsky region governor Oleg Kozhemyako upon arrival at the Khasan Railway Station ahead of a meeting with President Vladimir Putin
;

;Kim Jong-un has spoken of the “strategic importance” of his visit to Russia, ahead of expected weapons talks with Vladimir Putin at a space base in the remote region of Amur on Wednesday.

;

;The North Korean leader received a VIP welcome upon his arrival in Russia, with a military honour guard and the national anthems of both countries playing, state-run new agency KCNA reported. Kim told his Russian hosts that his visit was a “clear manifestation” of North Korea “prioritising the strategic importance” of its ties with Russia, it reported.

;

;Kim arrived on his private armoured train at Khasan station, the main rail gateway to Russia's far east from ;North Korea;, where Kim was filmed alighting and meeting the Russian environment minister, Alexander Kozlov, before continuing to travel north.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Pink leather armchairs and bomb-proof floors: inside Kim Jong-un's armoured train;

;
;

;Kim, reportedly accompanied by senior arms industry and military officials, then resumed his trip and could meet Putin on Wednesday after the Eastern Economic Forum in the Russian port city of Vladivostok, ;where Putin has already arrived;.

;

;The current route of his armoured train indicates that he will not visit Vladivostok as earlier expected and will go toward the remote Amur region further north instead. Putin has said he will visit the Vostochny Cosmodrome in that region on Wednesday and the space base would provide a secure location for the two leaders to hold their summit.

;

;Reporters granted access to the Russian leader at the Vladivostok forum refrained from asking Putin details of the visit but the president told journalists he would soon travel to the Vostochny Cosmodrome, a Russian spaceport some 1,000km (620 miles) from Vladivostok.

;

;“I've got my programme there, and when I get there you'll know,” he was quoted by Russian news agencies as saying.

;

;The cosmodrome would be a symbolic venue as two isolated leaders to build cooperation in the military and aerospace fields. North Korea has had several failed space launches and may seek Russia's aid to put its spy satellites into orbit. But so far the venue and the time of the meeting has not been confirmed.

;

;There are concerns in the west that Pyongyang plans to provide weapons to Moscow to replace stocks that have been heavily depleted during 18 months of fighting in ;Ukraine;.

;

;The shortage in ammunition has forced Russia to conserve its shells and rockets, impose daily fire limits, and focus more on precision guided types of munitions over volumes of fire, said Michael Kofman, a senior fellow in the Russia and Eurasia Program at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace.

;

;“Russia is mobilising production, but output will be quite short of their needs,” he said. “Therefore they are likely to seek import from any source that can help make up for the deficit.”

;

;Siemon Wezeman, a senior researcher at the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, said it was “entirely possible” North Korea had large stocks of ammunition that could be used by Russia.

;

;“Whether any deal is struck remains to be seen,” he said. “We will not know for sure until there is hard evidence that Russia has used North Korean arms and ammunition on the battlefield in Ukraine,” he added.

;

;Kim may also seek badly needed energy and food supplies. Russia's deputy foreign minister, Andrei Rudenko, said Russian officials may discuss humanitarian aid with the North Korean delegation, according to Russian news agencies.

;

;The White House warned last week that North Korea would “pay a price” if it supplies Russia with weaponry for the conflict in Ukraine.

;

;Kim is travelling to Russia with his top military officials including Korean People's Army Marshal Pak Jong-chon and Munitions Industry Department Director Jo Chun-ryong, analysts said.

;

;This indicates a Putin-Kim summit “is likely to heavily focus on Russia and North Korea's possible military cooperation,” Yang Moo-jin, president of the University of North Korean Studies in Seoul, told AFP.

;

;On Monday, the United States described Putin as desperate in seeking a meeting with Kim.

;

;“Having to travel across the length of his own country to meet with an international pariah to ask for assistance in a war that he expected to win in the opening month, I would characterise it as him begging for assistance,” State Department spokesman Matthew Miller said.

;

;Both Moscow and Pyongyang have denied North Korea has or will supply arms to Russia, which has eaten into its vast stockpiles of munitions since it launched its Ukraine offensive early last year.

;

;Kim has not travelled outside North Korea since the start of the coronavirus pandemic. His last proper overseas trip was in 2019, also to Russia to meet Putin.

;

;Andrei Lankov, a North Korea expert at Kookmin University in Seoul, told AFP that the upcoming meeting was part of Moscow's “gentle diplomatic blackmail” of Seoul because Russia did not want South Korea to supply weapons to Kyiv.

;

;Seoul is a major arms exporter and has sold tanks to Kyiv's ally Poland, but longstanding domestic policy bars it from selling weapons into active conflicts.

;

;“The major worry of the Russian government now is a possible shipment of the South Korean ammunition to Ukraine, not just one shipment but a lot of shipments,” Lankov said.

;

;;With Agence France-Presse;

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 08:22:01 +0800 New mothers may have enhanced ability to see faces in objectshttps://www.theguardian.com/society/2023/sep/13/new-mothers-may-have-enhanced-ability-to-see-faces-in-things-research
;;2023-09-12T23:01:42Z;
;
;;A piece of toast in which some perceive a likeness of Jesus on the right
;

;Whether it's seeing Jesus in burnt toast, a goofy grin in the grooves of a cheese grater, or simply the man in the moon, humans have long perceived faces in unlikely places.

;

;Now researchers say the tendency may not be fixed in adults, suggesting it appears to be enhanced in women who have just given birth.

;

;The scientists suggest the finding could be down to postpartum women having higher levels of oxytocin, colloquially referred to as the “love” or “trust” hormone because of its role in social bonding.

;

;“These data, collected online, suggest that our sensitivity to face-like patterns is not fixed and may change throughout adulthood,” the team write.

;

;;Writing in the journal Biology Letters;, researchers from Australia's University of Queensland and the University of the Sunshine Coast describe how they set out to investigate whether the propensity to see faces in inanimate objects – a phenomenon known as face pareidolia – changes during life.

;

;;Previous research; has suggested that when humans are given oxytocin, their ability to recognise ;certain emotions in faces increases;. As a result, the team wanted to explore if the hormone could play a role in how sensitive individuals are towards seeing faces in inanimate objects.

;

;The researchers used an online platform to recruit women, with participants asked if they were pregnant or had just given birth – the latter being a period when oxytocin levels are generally increased.

;

;The women were each shown 320 images in a random order online and asked to rate on an 11-point scale how easily they could see a face. While 32 of the images were of human faces, 256 were of inanimate objects with patterns that could be said to resemble a face, and 32 depicted inanimate objects with no such facial patterns.

;

;The team gathered data from 84 pregnant women, 79 women who had given birth in the past year, and 216 women who did not report being pregnant or having recently had a baby.

;
;

;;Related: ;;So happy to see you: our brains respond emotionally to faces we find in inanimate objects, study reveals;

;
;

;The results reveal that all participants easily recognised the images of human faces, and found it difficult to see faces in the 32 images of inanimate objects lacking facial patterns.

;

;However, women who had recently had a baby reported being able to see the 256 illusionary faces more easily than the pregnant women.

;

;The team say the results suggest sensitivity to perceiving faces is not stable throughout adulthood and changes during early parenthood, possibly to increase social bonding, adding this may be driven by higher levels of oxytocin.

;

;But, they note, since oxytocin levels were not measured in participants it is possible the results could be explained by other differences, such as levels of anxiety or stress.

;

;Joydeep Bhattacharya, a professor of psychology at Goldsmiths University of London who was not involved in the work, said it made sense to expect an increase in face processing in new mothers to help them read an infant's facial expressions.

;

;But, he said, the study did not delve into whether the ease of detecting faces in objects by postpartum women was linked to how baby-like the faces were or the expressions they were deemed to have, while levels of oxytocin were not measured, making it unclear whether the hormone was indeed involved.

;

;He added that the study was only conducted at one point in time and did not track how an individual's propensity to see faces in objects changed before and after having a baby, despite Bhattacharya noting previous studies showing huge variations in face pareidolia across individuals.

;

;“The findings elicit curiosity,” he said. “But we need more robust replications and proper measurements to make any reliable conclusion.”
